archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: This collection contains subject files, clippings, memorabilia and artifacts related to the American Civil War, collected by Elden E. Billings.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Elden E. Billings Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Elden E. Billings Collection, Ms91-036, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Elden E. Billings Papers were donated to Special Collections in 1991 with additional materials added.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement and description of the Elden E. Billings Collection commenced and was completed in August 2008. Earlier processing of the collection had been done in 1992. Additional description was completed in 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains subject files, clippings, memorabilia and artifacts related to the American Civil War. There are seven series, five of which predominately contain Civil War materials. The other two series in the collection also contains files on other subjects of Billings' historical interests, including aspects of military and United States history.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in seven series: Series I: Civil War Files and Prints; Series II: Other Subject Files; Series III: Lincoln Materials; Series IV: Elden E. Billings - Personel Files; Series V: Publications; Series VI: Primary Documents; and Series VII: Artifacts. Files in each series are arranged alphabetically by folder or item title.

Series I: Civil War Files and Prints contains subject files on various Civil War topics including specific battles, locations, regiments, and historic figures, as well as works of art, maps, and images. Other files include information on railroads, prisons, ethnic or social groups, and branches of the military.

Series II: Other Subject Files contains files on various topics, some tangentially related to the Civil War. Topics include, but are not limited to, figures from US military history, World Wars I and II, the Mexican War, railroads,
Series III: Lincoln Materials contains historical information about aspects of Lincoln's life and presidency. The series also includes cartoons, newsletters, portraits, and memorabilia.

Series IV: Elden E. Billings - Personal Files contains biographical information and photographs, correspondence to and from Billings, book catalogs, and notes relating to speaking events and writings.

Series V: Publications contains newsletters and journals, mostly from the Civil War period or about the Civil War. Other publications relate to Civil War Roundtables, historical societies, and military history.

Series VI: Primary Documents contains two subseries, Subseries A: Scrapbooks and Subseries B: Manuscripts. Subseries A: Scrapbooks includes several related to Civil War regiments or individuals. Subseries B: Manuscripts includes originals and typed copies of diaries, correspondence, and ephemera from the Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

Series VII: Artifacts contains several portraits, daguerrotypes, and photographs of Civil War figures, including Stonewall Jackson and Robert E. Lee. This series also contains medals, coins, calling cards, stamps, and other memorabilia. There are two non-Civil War related items: a print of an elephant fight from India, and a notebook that belonged to Ulysses S. Grant III.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: A portion of the Civil War books in the Special Collections Rare Book Collection were donated by Elden E. Billings. The department also houses a portrait of Elden E. "Josh" Billings.

did.unittitle: Series I: Civil War Files and Prints.
The Blue and the Gray, Curtis Paper Company, 4 black/white prints.
Chaplains of the U. S. Army.
Colonel Elmer E. Ellsworth, Currier & Ives print.

"Guide of the Confederate Government, An Official."
Lee's General Order Number Nine, a likeness as a keepsake for the members of The Civil War Round Table.
Loose pages from the Photographic History of the Civil War, 1910 by Brady.
Maps (10) Second Battle of Manassas Troop Movements.
Military Order of the Loyal Legion – Memoriums.
Northern Lake Frontier during the Civil War," 1897.
Notes on Civil War, handwritten by Billings.
Gen. E. O. C., Career of – Thesis, 1951.
Soldiers of the Civil War, 4 prints, Princeton Printing Co., 1962.
Texas and Pacific Railway, Rates to Dallas and return for Confederate Veterans Reunion.
Thomas, Gen. George H., paper on.
Tyrell, H. H. – RR pass, receipt, voucher and reunion ribbon.
Vicksburg, paper by H. C. Westwood.
Washington, D. C., Civil War era.
Files on City planning and Urban Development in Washington, D.C.
Grant, III, Lt. Col. U.S.S. Official Speeches, Articles.
Grant, III, Lt. Col. U. S. S., 1925-1928.
Oldest Inhabitants of D. C., Assn. of.
Evans, George W. – friend of Lincoln.
Lee and Lincoln prints, Civil War Times, 1963.

Lincoln Commission Flag specifications and Lincoln Silhouttes.
Lincoln and Music of the Civil War.

Mary Todd Lincoln Opera Committee – Opera 'Wing of Expectation.'

Swatches reputedly taken from the lining of Lincoln's coffin.

did.unittitle: Army War College, Study on Civil War, 1931.
Large scrapbook, 118th Regiment, Ohio Volunteer Infantry, 60 typewritten letters by or to - 2 Large Scrapbooks.
History of the 73rd Indiana Regiment by E. K. Barnhill.

Allan, Joe M., Abbyville, Miss., Dec. 15, 1862 to his cousin Charlene Morgan, in Minn. Allan describes war, traitors, rebels deserting, burning bridges, describes his tent and "two black boys who do our cooking and take care of our horses." Also mentions Grand Junction and Maj. Gen. U. S. Grant.

Bevel, G. A. (?) to 'Tom,' writes of service in the Confederacy until Jan. '63 when he 'played quits, scouting four months in Tenn. And then went 'over Cumberland Mountain into the Federal line," 1866.
Bierce, L. V., 3 letters, 2 written in 1870, 1 possibly earlier and possibly to Lincoln?
Binion, James, 10th Ga Infantry, in Virginia, typed copies, 1861-1864.
Bryant, Corp., S.O., 20th Michigan Infantry, typed 1863.,
Burns, Calvin J., copies of letters, 1864.
Burr, 'no first name,' Washington, D.C., Lincoln's death, April 28, 1865.
Butler, Calvin to his brother W. A. Wolcott, Mass. Original, 1864.
Carpenter, Lyman, writes from TN to his sister about battles in TN and getting smallpox and typhoid, typed, 1863.
Chancellorsville Letter, typed, from Camp Convalescent, June 2, 1863.
Civil War Diary of G. W. Pennington, 1862-1865.
Clift, R. H. to his mother, typed, re: Battle of Murfreesboro, January 10, 1862.
Cluseret, Gutave-Paul, handwritten transcription of letters by Billings.
Crawford, Samuel Wylie to George W. Reed original letter written from Huntsville Ala. Wylie reminisces about Sheridan’s last campaign, July 10, 1869.
Curtis, Lyman to Susan, original letter, writes about loss of son in battle, August 28, 1864.
Curtis, Gen. Samuel Ryan, typed copy of letter to his nephew, July 30, 1862.
Denver, Gen., letter on Sherman’s March into Miss., original, 1875.
Diaries, Memories (Civil War era) – all reproduced, transcribed, typed.
Eliza – ltr from, to sister and aunt, writes about Christmas, original, December 26, 1867.
Gillette, James (Capt. C.S.) writes to his mother about Battle of Chancelorsville May 9, 1863.,
Grant, U.S. to Major Gen. W. Sherman, copy of original, December 18, 1864.
Hyde, John E. (Private) of Mississippi, typed copies, 1865.
Letters, assorted Civil War, all copies.
Letter, Civil War, copy of – brother Phil to brother unknown, 1862.
Letter, partial to 'Bro' from 'unknown,' Lancaster, mentions 'Alexandria,' September 10, 1862.
Letter from son to father, Gainesville, Ga. Letterhead designates 'Office of Commissioner of Railroads' and son writes of horse and cost of hay, peas, sugar, September 19, 1899.
Letters, 4 original to Josie from Miranda – religious in subjects, 1865.
Letter to Abraham Lincoln, unsigned, n.d., subject hospitals and religion.
Manassas Junction, original letter from John 'undeciphered,' writes he had measles, the battle at Manassas, wounded, a 'Ball' in Fairfax and the ladies, July 28, 1861.
Mansfield, Richard H. cartoonist, his cartoons from newspaper.
McCarthy, John B. (?) Rockford, Illinois original letter, Aug. 31 ‘?’, to ‘?’ Clark writes about Mr. and Mrs. Lincoln.
Nine Mile Road, letter, brother to sister, July 1862.
Pace, Thomas N., Indiana Volunteers, Certificate of Service.
Sackey, John to his cousin Miss Mattie Turner, original letter from Camp Near Winchester Virginia, writes that he is weak from being sick, August 3, 1861.
Sewells Point Battery letter from L. C. Jones, discusses artillery, July 1, 1861.
Sherman, W. T. Gen., (copies of letters), 1863, 1864, 1888.
Sherman, W. T., signed by Sherman but written by unknown, 1887.
Struthers, Jeannie Gourlay to Allen Clark, [Lincoln flag], 1924.
Taliaferro, W. B. to General W. W. Loring, typed, January 29, 1862.
Warner, Charles, 145th N.Y. Reg., letters typed and transcribed, 1862-1863.
Wiggenton, Thomas S.R. to Capt. J. Thomas Clark, original letter written at Racoonford, VA writes about death, wounds and captures, August 20, 1863.
Wolcott, I. H. P., original letters, plus typed and transcribed copies, 1863.
Elephant Fight, print from Chandni Chowk, Delhi.
